page.title: 07Railway Depot In Ince
page.content: Springs Branch is an important railway depot and junction in Lower Ince. Over 150 men work there, most of them are engine drivers. Twenty-three men drive Diesel Multiple units on the passenger services between Wigan and other N.W. towns and cities. Twenty drivers work coal trains from nearby collieries to Fiddler's Ferry Power Station, Widnes. These are known as 'Merry-go-round' trains since they go round a loop at each end of the line never stopping whilst they load or un-load. Thirty more men are relief drivers who cover for those on holiday or sick. They also work special services for football matches etc. The rest of the drivers man express passenger or freight trains between Crewe and Carlisle. Apart from the drivers there are also many guards, inspectors and maintenance men in the huge repair sheds.
